Prompt Level: 3.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph about your favorite holiday or celebration. Remember to use adjectives to spice up your writing. As you write, consider these questions: **What's the name of the holiday or celebration? How long does it last? How do people usually celebrate it? How do you celebrate it?** Write 40-60 words. [SEP] Response: My favorite holiday is Christmas. It’s celebrated on December 25th and lasts for about a week, with preparations starting early. People decorate their homes with twinkling lights and colorful ornaments. Families gather for a delicious feast, exchange thoughtful gifts, and enjoy the festive spirit. Christmas is a warm, joyful, and magical time of year. [SEP] Correction: <input>My favorite holiday is Christmas. It’s celebrated on December 25th and lasts for about a week, with preparations starting early. People decorate their homes with twinkling lights and colorful ornaments. Families gather for a delicious feast, exchange thoughtful gifts, and enjoy the festive spirit. Christmas is a warm, joyful, and magical time of year.</input>

Prompt Level: 14.0 [SEP] Prompt: Read the email from your manager. Then write an interesting, friendly advertisement for the policy change. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: **Exciting News! Free Breakfasts for All Employees Starting Next Month!** Dear Team, We are thrilled to announce a delicious new perk coming your way! Starting the first Monday of next month, our company will be providing **free breakfasts** to all employees. Imagine starting your day with a delightful spread of fresh fruit, creamy yogurt, crunchy cereals, bagels, and mouth-watering doughnuts. But that's not all! Each day, we'll feature a special hot item, ranging from fluffy scrambled eggs and crispy potatoes to golden pancakes drizzled with maple syrup. And to wash it all down, we'll have freshly brewed coffees and teas, along with refreshing fresh-squeezed orange and grapefruit juices. We hope this new initiative will not only ease your morning rush but also give us all a chance to connect and socialize before diving into our workday. Let's make breakfast the best part of our day! Get ready to enjoy and let's make this a huge success together! Best regards, Tanuja [SEP] Correction: **Exciting News! Free Breakfasts for All Employees Starting Next Month!** Dear Team, We are thrilled to announce a delicious new perk coming your way! Starting the first Monday of next month, our company will be providing **free breakfasts** to all employees. Imagine starting your day with a delightful spread of fresh fruit, creamy yogurt, crunchy cereals, bagels, and mouth-watering doughnuts. But that's not all! Each day, we'll feature a special hot item, ranging from fluffy scrambled eggs and crispy potatoes to golden pancakes drizzled with maple syrup. And to wash it all down, we'll have freshly brewed coffees and teas, along with refreshing fresh-squeezed orange and grapefruit juices. We hope this new initiative will not only ease your morning rush but also give us all a chance to connect and socialize before diving into our workday. Let's make breakfast the best part of our day! Get ready to enjoy and let's make this a huge success together! Best regards, Tanuja

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your manager wants you to write a formal email to the rest of the team about the priorities. Use the notes to help you. Remember to edit your email before sending it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Subject: Project Priorities – Key Focus Areas Dear Team, I hope you're all doing well. I’d like to take a moment to highlight our current priorities and provide some guidance moving forward. Our top priority right now is the US client designs. While progress has been a bit slow, it’s still within acceptable limits. Let’s continue putting in our best effort here—if we deliver strong results, there's a good chance the client will return with more work. Keep up the great work! Secondly, staffing is a pressing concern. As you may know, two team members will be leaving in Q2. We need to begin the search for suitable replacements as soon as possible. If you know anyone who might be a good fit, please reach out to me directly. Lastly, the marketing media reorganization project is on hold for now. It requires a significant amount of effort, and since we’re not actively using that media, we’ve decided to freeze the project temporarily. Thank you all for your hard work and commitment. [SEP] Correction: Subject: Project Priorities – Key Focus Areas Dear Team, I hope you're all doing well. I’d like to take a moment to highlight our current priorities and provide some guidance moving forward. Our top priority right now is the US client designs. While progress has been a bit slow, it’s still within acceptable limits. Let’s continue putting in our best effort here—if we deliver strong results, there's a good chance the client will return with more work. Keep up the great work! Secondly, staffing is a pressing concern. As you may know, two team members will be leaving in Q2. We need to begin the search for suitable replacements as soon as possible. If you know anyone who might be a good fit, please reach out to me directly. Lastly, the marketing media reorganization project is on hold for now. It requires a significant amount of effort, and since we’re not actively using that media, we’ve decided to freeze the project temporarily. Thank you all for your hard work and commitment.

Prompt Level: 10.0 [SEP] Prompt: An old friend has emailed you, describing what he's been doing for the last decade. Pretend you have two kids living abroad, and write a response describing what they have been doing. Type in the input box. Write 50-100 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: It’s so nice to hear from you after all these years! A lot has happened on my end too. I have two kids now, and they’re both living abroad. My daughter has been working as a graphic designer in Canada for the past five years, and my son has been studying engineering in Germany. We stay in touch often, and I’m so proud of everything they’ve been doing. Let’s catch up more soon! [SEP] Correction: It’s so nice to hear from you after all these years! A lot has happened on my end too. I have two kids now, and they’re both living abroad. My daughter has been working as a graphic designer in Canada for the past five years, and my son has been studying engineering in Germany. We stay in touch often, and I’m so proud of everything they’ve been doing. Let’s catch up more soon!

I am very much looking forward to your response. Best regards, Stef Shaw, manager of special projects [SEP] Correction: ToAll Stef, Please wait for an email from EF Student, who will give you everything you need. H Hi, Helena. That is great news. Prompt Level: 10.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your manager sent you an email, asking you to do the company update. In your own words, write an outline for your presentation. Your outline should include an introduction, the main points, a summary and next steps. Type in the input box. Write 80-120 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: Presentation Outline for Company Update Introduction: Greet the team and mention you are presenting on behalf of the manager. Main Points: Recent Acquisition of Smoot Computers: Announce the acquisition and its strategic benefits. Mention the expected completion date. Current Financial Performance: Provide an overview of the latest financial results. Upcoming Projects and Initiatives: Outline major projects in the pipeline. Summary: Recap key points and emphasize positive impacts. Next Steps: Encourage engagement and mention follow-up actions. Presentation Outline for Company Update [SEP] Correction: Presentation Outline for Company Update Introduction: Greet the team and mention you are presenting on behalf of the manager. Main Points: Recent Acquisition of Smoot Computers: Announce the acquisition and its strategic benefits. Mention the expected completion date. Current Financial Performance: Provide an overview of the latest financial results. Upcoming Projects and Initiatives: Outline major projects in the pipeline. Summary: Recap key points and emphasize positive impacts. Next Steps: Encourage engagement and mention follow-up actions. Presentation Outline for Company Update

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: I hope you're both doing well! After reading your emails and considering the options for our upcoming trip, I’d like to propose a third alternative: Vancouver, Canada. It’s a city that perfectly balances outdoor adventure with urban sophistication. Vancouver is known for its stunning natural beauty, offering a variety of outdoor activities. You can hike in the nearby mountains, explore Stanley Park’s trails, or enjoy kayaking in False Creek. The city also has a vibrant arts and culture scene, with incredible museums, galleries, and live performances. Plus, the food scene is fantastic—Vancouver is famous for its diverse cuisine, from fresh seafood to a wide variety of Asian dishes. The weather is relatively mild compared to other Canadian cities, making it a great year-round destination. Whether we’re seeking adventure, relaxation, or cultural experiences, Vancouver has something to offer for everyone. Let me know your thoughts on this idea! [SEP] Correction: I hope you're both doing well! After reading your emails and considering the options for our upcoming trip, I’d like to propose a third alternative: Vancouver, Canada. It’s a city that perfectly balances outdoor adventure with urban sophistication. Vancouver is known for its stunning natural beauty, offering a variety of outdoor activities. You can hike in the nearby mountains, explore Stanley Park’s trails, or enjoy kayaking in False Creek. The city also has a vibrant arts and culture scene, with incredible museums, galleries, and live performances. Plus, the food scene is fantastic—Vancouver is famous for its diverse cuisine, from fresh seafood to a wide variety of Asian dishes. The weather is relatively mild compared to other Canadian cities, making it a great year-round destination. Whether we’re seeking adventure, relaxation, or cultural experiences, Vancouver has something to offer for everyone. Let me know your thoughts on this idea!

Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your company is changing its logo, and two managers are discussing how to explain the change. Listen to their conversation and write a formal email based on what you hear. Type in the input box. Write 120–150 words. [SEP] Response: Dear, We are excited to share some significant news regarding our brand identity. As part of our commitment to staying ahead in our industry and resonating with modern market trends, we are introducing a new, more contemporary logo. This update reflects our dedication to maintaining our position as a leader in our segment. A modernized logo not only aligns with the expectations of today's dynamic market but also enhances our reputation as an innovative and forward-thinking organization. We understand the importance of this change and value the perspectives of our stakeholders. Therefore, we are open to hearing your thoughts and feedback about the new logo. Your input will be invaluable in ensuring this transition reflects the shared vision and aspirations of our community. Thank you for your continued support and trust as we evolve to serve you better. Warm regards [SEP] Correction: Dear, We are excited to share some significant news regarding our brand identity. As part of our commitment to staying ahead in our industry and resonating with modern market trends, we are introducing a new, more contemporary logo. This update reflects our dedication to maintaining our position as a leader in our segment. A modernized logo not only aligns with the expectations of today's dynamic market but also enhances our reputation as an innovative and forward-thinking organization. We understand the importance of this change and value the perspectives of our stakeholders. Therefore, we are open to hearing your thoughts and feedback about the new logo. Your input will be invaluable in ensuring this transition reflects the shared vision and aspirations of our community. Thank you for your continued support and trust as we evolve to serve you better. Warm regards

Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: An airplane has many important parts that help it fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane. It holds the passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots sit. The fuselage is strong and shaped to reduce air resistance. The wings are attached to the fuselage and are very important for flying. They create lift, which helps the airplane rise into the air. Wings also have flaps and ailerons that help the pilot control the plane’s movement during takeoff, flight, and landing. The tail of the airplane includes the vertical and horizontal stabilizers. These parts keep the airplane stable and help control its direction. The vertical stabilizer helps the airplane turn left or right, while the horizontal stabilizer controls the up and down movement. Finally, the engines provide the power needed for the airplane to move forward. They push or pull the plane through the air and help it gain speed for takeoff and maintain speed during flight. All these parts work together to make flying possible and safe. [SEP] Correction: An airplane has many important parts that help it fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane. It holds the passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots sit. The fuselage is strong and shaped to reduce air resistance. The wings are attached to the fuselage and are very important for flying. They create lift, which helps the airplane rise into the air. Wings also have flaps and ailerons that help the pilot control the plane’s movement during takeoff, flight, and landing. The tail of the airplane includes the vertical and horizontal stabilizers. These parts keep the airplane stable and help control its direction. The vertical stabilizer helps the airplane turn left or right, while the horizontal stabilizer controls the up and down movement. Finally, the engines provide the power needed for the airplane to move forward. They push or pull the plane through the air and help it gain speed for takeoff and maintain speed during flight. All these parts work together to make flying possible and safe.

Prompt Level: 12.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your friend Kim needs help with emails. Read the beginning of the email. Then, make a list of tips for writing effective emails. Type in the input box. Write 70-90 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: Dear Kim, Here are some tips for writing effective emails: Subject Line: Make it clear and specific to help the recipient understand the email's purpose at a glance. CC-ing: Only CC relevant individuals to avoid unnecessary clutter in inboxes. Bullet List: Use bullet points for easy-to-read information, especially when outlining key points. Attachments: Mention any attachments in the body of the email and ensure they’re properly labeled. Keep the tone polite, proofread for errors, and always include a clear call to action when needed. [SEP] Correction: Dear Kim, Here are some tips for writing effective emails: Subject Line: Make it clear and specific to help the recipient understand the email's purpose at a glance. CC-ing: Only CC relevant individuals to avoid unnecessary clutter in inboxes. Bullet List: Use bullet points for easy-to-read information, especially when outlining key points. Attachments: Mention any attachments in the body of the email and ensure they’re properly labeled. Keep the tone polite, proofread for errors, and always include a clear call to action when needed.

Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. [SEP] Response: On June 13, 2010, at 1818 Pacific Daylight Time, InterStar Airways Flight 293, landed at San Francisco International Airport (SFO), San Francisco, California, with the nose wheels cocked at 90 degrees. InterStar Airways was operating the airplane as a scheduled domestic passenger flight. The captain, first officer, four flight attendants, and 141 passengers were not injured. The flight departed Oakland, California, at 1531 as a non-stop to Sky Harbor International Airport, Phoenix, Arizona. The captain noted no problems during the initial departure, and observed a positive rate of climb. The flight crew noted an error message displayed on the control board. There was a fault message for a nose landing gear shock absorber. The data indicated that the gear handle was positioned to the down position, and there was an error message of a fault for the nose wheel steering. The flight diverted to San Jose, California. The captain was asked to perform a flyby of the tower for verification on the gear status. The tower, InterStar ground personnel, and a local news helicopter advised him that the nose gear was cocked 90 degrees to the left. When he found out this information, the captain decided to divert to SFO because it had optimum field conditions, a longer runway, and a better emergency support services. The crew flew for several hours to burn fuel so that they could land at a lighter weight. The captain advised the cabin crew that in the event that the nose gear collapsed, evacuation from the front doors was not available so everyone would deplane from the rear exits. The flight crew continually updated the cabin crew and passengers about the situation, and advised the cabin crew to prepare for emergency procedures. The captain flew the airplane for the landing. He touched down at 120 knots, and applied normal braking at 90 knots. He held the nose gear off of the ground as long as possible. At 60 knots, the flight crew shut down the engines. They did not use reverse thrust or auto-braking. During the landing, the forward cabin crew could smell burnt rubber. The air traffic control tower confirmed that there was no fire, and the captain announced this to the cabin crew. After this notification, the passengers deplaned normally using an air stair. Upon touchdown, the tires rapidly deflated and tore apart, and both wheels were worn into the axle. During landing, the airplane's trajectory was not affected by the abnormal configuration or subsequent tire destruction, and the airplane stayed on the runway centerline. Prompt Level: 12.0 [SEP] Prompt: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: I work for a global company. I've been lucky enough to travel around the world and do business with many different people in many different countries. What I've learned is that understanding cross-cultural differences is critical for successful communication. For example, people from my culture are apt to maintain eye contact in a conversation. In some countries I've visited, however, maintaining eye contact can be considered rather rude or even aggressive. I also have a way of gesturing a lot – you know, like moving my hands and pointing. In one country, I learned that pointing with a finger is somewhat impolite. Oh, yeah – and I have a tendency to talk a lot and be quite direct. I also tend to be a little uncomfortable with silence. There are a lot of countries where just the opposite is true. I guess my point is that it's important to be sensitive to the culture you're working in. You don't have to be perfect, but a little understanding goes a long way! [SEP] Correction: I work for a global company. In one country, I learned that pointing with a finger is somewhat impolite. Oh, yeah – and I have a tendency to talk a lot and be quite direct. I also tend to be a little uncomfortable with silence. Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: Learning a new language is both exciting and challenging. One of the most common issues language learners face is fear of making mistakes. Many students feel embarrassed when speaking, which can limit their progress and confidence. Pronunciation and grammar rules also present difficulties, especially when they differ significantly from the learner's native language. Another major challenge is vocabulary retention. Even after learning new words, it’s easy to forget them without frequent practice. This is especially true when learners don’t have enough opportunities to use the language in real-life situations. Lack of immersion or exposure to native speakers can make it harder to improve listening and speaking skills. Additionally, motivation plays a big role. Some students feel discouraged if they don’t see quick results, especially when progress seems slow. To overcome these obstacles, learners need consistent practice, supportive learning environments, and tools like language apps or conversation partners. Setting small, achievable goals can also help students stay motivated and track their progress. Despite these challenges, language learning is a rewarding experience that opens doors to new cultures and opportunities. With patience and the right strategies, learners can overcome their fears and become more confident speakers. [SEP] Correction: Learning a new language is both exciting and challenging. One of the most common issues language learners face is fear of making mistakes. Many students feel embarrassed when speaking, which can limit their progress and confidence. Pronunciation and grammar rules also present difficulties, especially when they differ significantly from the learner's native language. Another major challenge is vocabulary retention. Even after learning new words, it’s easy to forget them without frequent practice. This is especially true when learners don’t have enough opportunities to use the language in real-life situations. Lack of immersion or exposure to native speakers can make it harder to improve listening and speaking skills. Additionally, motivation plays a big role. Some students feel discouraged if they don’t see quick results, especially when progress seems slow. To overcome these obstacles, learners need consistent practice, supportive learning environments, and tools like language apps or conversation partners. Setting small, achievable goals can also help students stay motivated and track their progress. Despite these challenges, language learning is a rewarding experience that opens doors to new cultures and opportunities. With patience and the right strategies, learners can overcome their fears and become more confident speakers.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: he North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade accord between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, which came into effect in January 1994 after years of negotiation. Its primary goal was to eliminate or significantly reduce customs duties and trade barriers among the three member countries, thereby promoting free trade and economic integration across North America. NAFTA had a profound impact on trade relations, particularly in sectors like agriculture. For example, it facilitated the large-scale export of Mexican fruits and vegetables to the U.S., enhancing food availability and lowering prices. The agreement also encouraged cross-border investments and the development of integrated supply chains, especially in manufacturing and automotive industries. However, NAFTA’s effects were not uniformly positive. While it boosted overall trade and economic growth, it also led to job displacements in certain industries, particularly in manufacturing sectors in the U.S. and Canada. In Mexico, small-scale farmers faced increased competition from subsidized U.S. agricultural products. Despite these challenges, NAFTA is widely regarded as beneficial to all three countries, laying the foundation for deeper economic cooperation. It was eventually replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2020, which updated and modernized many of its provisions. NAFTA had a profound impact on trade relations, particularly in sectors like agriculture. For example, it facilitated the large-scale export of Mexican fruits and vegetables to the U.S., enhancing food availability and lowering prices. While it boosted overall trade and economic growth, it also led to job displacements in certain industries, particularly in manufacturing sectors in the U.S. and Canada. In Mexico, small-scale farmers faced increased competition from subsidized U.S. agricultural products. Despite these challenges, NAFTA is widely regarded as beneficial to all three countries, laying the foundation for deeper economic cooperation. It was eventually replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2020, which updated and modernized many of its provisions.

Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. [SEP] Response: On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293 encountered a significant landing gear issue that led to a challenging landing at San Francisco International Airport. The flight, which took off from Oakland en route to Phoenix, encountered a fault message for the nose landing gear shortly after departure. The crew initially diverted to San Jose but later chose San Francisco for its better runway and emergency facilities after a flyby confirmed the nose gear was rotated 90 degrees. Before landing, the crew burned fuel to reduce the aircraft's weight and prepared passengers for a potential emergency evacuation. During landing, the captain managed to keep the nose gear off the ground until 60 knots, at which point the engines were shut down. Despite the front tires deflating and tearing upon contact, the aircraft stayed aligned on the runway, allowing passengers to deplane safely via an air stair without incident. Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words. [SEP] Response: Good morning everyone, and welcome to Frisko Shipping! I’m excited to have the opportunity to introduce you to our company today. I know you’ve all come here with great enthusiasm and a desire to be part of something special, and I can promise you, Frisko Shipping is exactly that. But don’t just take my word for it—let’s dive into the story behind our global success and see why you’re joining a team that’s truly exceptional. Let me begin with a brief history. Frisko Shipping was founded in 2001 by Bill Frisko, a visionary with a passion for global trade. What started as a small shipping company has now grown into a powerhouse with locations in 20 cities across the world. With over 5,000 employees, we’ve built an international network that moves millions of goods every day, connecting markets and communities in ways that many companies only dream of. Last year, we achieved a profit of 5 million dollars and captured 10% of the global market. It’s an impressive track record, and it reflects the dedication of every person who has worked here—and now, that includes you! But it’s not just about the numbers. We believe that people are at the heart of everything we do. We want you to bring your enthusiasm, your motivation, and your drive to the table. New employees like you are expected to bring fresh ideas and energy into the company, and in return, we promise you’ll be part of a company that values growth, creativity, and a strong sense of teamwork. Now, let me share an anecdote about Bill Frisko himself. Many of you may already know that Bill’s journey to founding Frisko Shipping wasn’t a typical one. In fact, it was an experience that could’ve been the end of his career. On one of his early adventures, Bill fell into the ocean and was bitten by a shark. But rather than letting this life-changing moment defeat him, Bill saw it as a sign to make a change. In fact, the very ship that rescued him became the inspiration for the birth of Frisko Shipping. Bill often says that you can find inspiration in the most unexpected places—even in the middle of a life-threatening situation. And that’s the kind of mindset we value here. Anything can happen, and with the right perspective, it can lead to incredible opportunities. Before I finish, I want to make sure you’re thinking ahead—not just about what Frisko Shipping is today, but about what we can become together. So, here’s a little challenge for you: How much do you really know about the company you’ve just joined? I’d like to kick things off with a fun quiz to see how many facts you’ve already picked up. It’s a great way to test your knowledge and get you even more excited about being a part of our journey. In conclusion, as you step into your new roles, remember that you’re not just joining a company—you’re joining a movement. A movement that began with a spark of inspiration and has grown into something truly global. So, let’s work together, think outside the box, and continue to build on the foundation of success that we’ve all worked so hard to create. Welcome aboard, and let’s get started! [SEP] Response: One legendary creature that is popular in India is the Naga, a serpent deity often depicted in Hindu and Buddhist mythology. Nagas are considered powerful and divine beings, usually portrayed as half-human and half-snake. They are believed to reside in the underworld and are guardians of treasures, both material and spiritual. In many stories, Nagas are associated with water bodies like rivers, lakes, and oceans, and are revered for their ability to control rain and fertility. Nagas can be both benevolent and malevolent. They are known to protect their devotees and bring prosperity, but can also be vengeful if disrespected. Temples dedicated to Nagas can be found throughout India, where people offer prayers and rituals to seek their blessings. The symbolism of Nagas extends beyond mythology, representing the duality of nature—creation and destruction, life and death. Their presence in folklore and religious practices highlights the deep connection between humans and the natural world. I find the Naga fascinating because of its rich cultural significance and the way it embodies the balance of opposing forces. What legendary creature do you find interesting? Following a period of considerable volatility earlier this year, the index has shown consistent gains through April, supported by a combination of improved corporate earnings and proactive economic policy measures in China. Key sectors, particularly technology and financial services, have contributed significantly to the HSI’s performance, buoyed by strong quarterly results and optimism surrounding government-led stimulus initiatives. Analysts note that efforts to stabilize the property sector and enhance domestic consumption have played a pivotal role in bolstering market confidence. Nonetheless, external risks—including heightened geopolitical tensions and the potential impact of slower global trade—continue to pose challenges. Market observers advise maintaining a cautious outlook, emphasizing that while recent trends are encouraging, volatility remains a significant factor. In summary, the Hang Seng Index’s recent rebound signals tentative recovery, contingent on continued economic support and improved macroeconomic conditions both domestically and internationally. Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: The Challenges of Language Learning: Overcoming Common Hurdles

Learning a new language can be an exciting yet daunting journey. Many students face a variety of challenges that can make the process seem overwhelming. What are some of these common issues, and how can they be addressed?

One major challenge is vocabulary retention. Students often struggle to remember new words and phrases. This can be mitigated by using flashcards, engaging in regular practice, and immersing oneself in the language through media like movies, music, and books.

Another issue is pronunciation. Many learners find it difficult to master the sounds of a new language, especially if they are very different from their native tongue. Practicing with native speakers, using language learning apps, and listening to the language as much as possible can help improve pronunciation.

Grammar is another stumbling block. The rules of a new language can be complex and different from what students are used to. Breaking down grammar rules into smaller, manageable parts and practicing them in context can make them easier to understand and remember.

Confidence is also a significant barrier. Many students fear making mistakes and feel embarrassed when speaking. It's important to remember that making mistakes is a natural part of the learning process. Joining language exchange groups or practicing with friends can help build confidence.

Finally, consistency is key. Regular practice is essential for language acquisition. Setting aside dedicated time each day for language study and practice can lead to steady progress. [SEP] Correction: <input>The Challenges of Language Learning: Overcoming Common Hurdles

Learning a new language can be an exciting yet daunting journey. Many students face a variety of challenges that can make the process seem overwhelming. What are some of these common issues, and how can they be addressed?

One major challenge is vocabulary retention. Students often struggle to remember new words and phrases. This can be mitigated by using flashcards, engaging in regular practice, and immersing oneself in the language through media like movies, music, and books.

Another issue is pronunciation. Many learners find it difficult to master the sounds of a new language, especially if they are very different from their native tongue. Practicing with native speakers, using language learning apps, and listening to the language as much as possible can help improve pronunciation.

Grammar is another stumbling block. The rules of a new language can be complex and different from what students are used to. Breaking down grammar rules into smaller, manageable parts and practicing them in context can make them easier to understand and remember.

Confidence is also a significant barrier. Many students fear making mistakes and feel embarrassed when speaking. It's important to remember that making mistakes is a natural part of the learning process. Joining language exchange groups or practicing with friends can help build confidence.

Finally, consistency is key. Regular practice is essential for language acquisition. Setting aside dedicated time each day for language study and practice can lead to steady progress.</input>

Additionally, taking an active interest in your employees' career paths by offering training and mentorship will show that you care about their growth and development. Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a summary of no more than 50-60 words about the case. Use the words below. This is a non-graded activity. [SEP] Response: The Chicago Seven Verdict The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating. In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The reasons for the reversal involved bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case. During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines. In contrast, Kerala, situated in the lush southwestern region of India, is known for its serene backwaters, tropical greenery, and peaceful beaches. While Jaipur offers a glimpse into India’s royal history and desert life, Kerala provides a soothing experience close to nature. She looked apprehensive and was very worried. I calmed her down and she responded reasonably well. She had a newspaper in her hand and methodically folded the wrinkled newspaper. After a few seconds her eyes slowly closed and she was fast asleep. It was then that I left the hospital room and went home. After years of negotiation, it officially came into force in January 1994. NAFTA’s primary objective was to reduce or eliminate customs duties among the member states, thereby fostering increased trade and economic cooperation. NAFTA has significantly impacted trade relations, especially in the agricultural sector. For instance, it has facilitated the flow of Mexican fruits and vegetables into the US market, benefiting both producers and consumers. The agreement has had both positive and negative effects on its members. While it has boosted trade and economic growth, it has also faced criticism for contributing to job losses in certain industries and raising environmental concerns. Despite these challenges, NAFTA has overall been beneficial to all three member countries, enhancing economic integration and cooperation across North America. It has created a more interconnected and competitive regional market, leading to increased investment and innovation. The agreement has also paved the way for further economic collaboration and development among the United States, Canada, and Mexico. [SEP] Response: Communication between pilots and the air control tower is essential for safe and efficient air travel. This begins even before takeoff, with pilots receiving departure clearance, flight plans, and weather updates. Once airborne, pilots stay in constant contact with control towers, updating their position, altitude, and speed. The language used is precise and standardized to avoid misunderstandings, with specific terms and phrases set by the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO). Numbers are articulated clearly, and time is given in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). As the aircraft nears its destination, communication is crucial. Pilots receive descent, approach, and landing instructions, often navigating busy airspace. The control tower ensures safe distances between aircraft. In emergencies, this communication is vital for pilots to receive immediate assistance and information. In summary, continuous dialogue between pilots and air control towers is critical for safe and orderly air traffic management worldwide. Prompt Level: 12.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. What qualities do you think are most important? Do you think everyone has the potential to be a leader? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: Developing leadership qualities is often a combination of self-awareness, experience, and continuous learning. I've seen that great leaders are not born, but made through effort and reflection. One essential quality is emotional intelligence — the ability to understand and manage your emotions, as well as those of others. Leaders who can empathize and communicate effectively tend to inspire trust and build stronger teams. Another key trait is resilience. Challenges and setbacks are inevitable, but the best leaders handle them with a positive mindset, using failures as learning experiences. This quality can be developed by embracing difficult situations rather than avoiding them. I’ve also observed that humility plays a huge role. Effective leaders don’t act as if they know everything. They are open to feedback and willing to admit when they’re wrong, which makes them approachable and respected. In my opinion, almost everyone has the potential to be a leader if they’re willing to work on themselves and embrace these qualities. Leadership isn’t just about authority, but about inspiring and guiding others toward a common goal. Using flashcards and practicing regular can help. Another challenge is grammar. Each language have different rules, and they can be confusing. For example, verb tenses or sentence structure might be very different from the student’s native language. This sometimes causes mistakes or slow progress. Pronunciation is also a big problem. Some sounds might not exist in the learner’s first language, making it hard to speak clearly. This can lead to misunderstanding or low confidence when speaking. Additionally, many learners feel shy or afraid to speak with native speakers. Fear of making mistakes or being judged often stops students from practicing, which slow down their improvement. Finally, motivation can drop over time. Learning a language takes patience, and some students gives up because progress seems too slow. In conclusion, vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation, confidence, and motivation are common challenges in language learning. Understanding these issues can help learners find better strategies and keep moving forward. What challenges do you face when learning a language? Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: I believe that companies do have a responsibility to society, and this goes beyond just making a profit for their shareholders. While it’s important for businesses to be profitable, they also operate in communities that support them. These communities, as well as the environment, play a key role in their success. Companies should consider their impact on these areas and contribute to their well-being.

Corporate social responsibility (CSR) can lead to long-term benefits for companies. For example, by adopting sustainable business practices, companies can protect resources for the future while also reducing their carbon footprint. Providing fair wages and good working conditions for employees can lead to higher job satisfaction, lower turnover, and greater productivity. This is not only beneficial for the company but also for the individuals and families it supports.

Additionally, consumers are increasingly aware of companies’ social and environmental impacts. They are more likely to support businesses that demonstrate ethical behavior and contribute positively to society. A strong CSR program can help build trust and loyalty among customers, which ultimately helps the company’s bottom line.

In conclusion, CSR is not just about charity or public image. It’s a smart and ethical business practice that benefits both the company and the society in which it operates. In healthcare, robotic surgery systems allow doctors to perform delicate procedures with greater accuracy, reducing recovery times for patients. One of the most notable impacts of NAFTA has been on agricultural trade. While it has boosted trade and economic growth, some industries and workers have faced challenges due to increased competition and shifts in production. Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: An airplane is composed of several key components, each serving a specific function to ensure flight and stability. The fuselage is the central body of the airplane, designed to accommodate passengers, cargo, and the cockpit. It provides structural support and is streamlined to minimize air resistance. The wings are critical for flight, as they generate lift by interacting with the airflow. The shape of the wings, known as the airfoil, helps create a pressure difference between the upper and lower surfaces, allowing the airplane to ascend and remain airborne. Wings also house the ailerons and flaps, which assist in controlling roll and adjusting lift during takeoff and landing. The tail of an airplane, also known as the empennage, includes the vertical and horizontal stabilizers. The vertical stabilizer, or fin, prevents yawing, which is the side-to-side motion of the aircraft. Attached is the rudder, used to steer the aircraft left or right. The horizontal stabilizer assists in maintaining pitch stability, with the elevators attached to control the ascent and descent. Engines are the powerhouses of the airplane, providing the thrust necessary to propel it forward. They can be mounted on the wings or the fuselage and are crucial for generating the speed required for lift-off and sustaining flight. Together, these parts work in harmony to achieve controlled and efficient aviation. Also, take an active interest in their career development. Offer training opportunities and mentorship to help them grow professionally.

A healthy work-life balance is crucial. Recognize that employees have personal lives and allow them the flexibility to manage both. Listening to your employees, especially when they voice concerns, can also improve morale and productivity. Treat your subordinates the same way you would like to be treated by your superiors.

Good luck with your team!

The fuselage must be strong, aerodynamically correct, airtight and, of course, reliable, because in the air it will have to withstand loads of different strengths. The wings have a slightly rounded shape, which helps the aircraft during takeoff and landing. Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: The current situation of the Spanish real estate market is broadly characterised by the high demand for housing, especially new construction, and the shortage of supply. As a result of this mismatch between supply and demand, the price of housing continues to rise. The average price of new housing in Spain has reached €2,930/m² in June 2024, with large cities such as Barcelona (€5,262/m²) and Madrid (€4,493/m²) having the highest demand, the lowest supply and, consequently, the highest prices. All these factors, combined with the fact that the average salary in Spain is relatively low, around €2,200 gross per month, mean that most people have to apply for a bank loan to buy their home. In Spain, you can buy a home through real estate agencies or from individual to individual. Buying a property from an individual offers personalised service and saves on commissions, while real estate agencies offer expert advice and speed up the paperwork. Once you have found the perfect house, it is time to face the process of applying for a loan. The main requirements of banks when granting a mortgage have to do with the applicant's financial situation. In order to know the stability and good current and future financial solvency of the client, the bank asks for pay slips and work history, and checks that he or she has no other outstanding debts. A good tip when applying for a loan, is to compare different mortgage loan offers from different banking entities. During this process, you also have to decide which type of mortgage best fits your financial situation: - Fixed rate: the same installment and the same interest rate during the life of the mortgage. - Variable rate: the interest rate, and consequently the installment, vary depending on the reference index published by the banking entities, which is reviewed every 6 months. - Mixed rate: a fixed rate is applied during the first years of the loan and then a variable interest rate is applied. Another aspect to take into account is the fees associated with the application and granting of the mortgage loan: - Opening fee: paid to the bank at the beginning of the loan for paperwork and management. - Account fee associated with the mortgage: opening an account, with associated fees, to manage the payment of the installments. In addition, we must not forget that mortgages have a financing limit of up to 80% of the value of the property, as well as an amortization period ranging from 20 to 30 years. In short, taking out a mortgage is a long process that requires taking time to carefully study the options and possibilities in order to obtain the best financing. Unlike traditional fitness centers that often lack satisfying food options, Zen will offer a nutritious gourmet menu crafted by top chefs from renowned restaurants. Guests will have access to fully equipped gyms, swimming pools, and trained instructors to enhance their stay. Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Chennai and Mumbai, two major cities in India, offer distinct yet equally fascinating experiences. Chennai, located in the southern part of the country, is known for its rich cultural heritage and serene beaches. In contrast, Mumbai, the financial capital, is a bustling metropolis that never sleeps, characterized by its fast-paced lifestyle and vibrant nightlife.

In Chennai (X), the pace of life is relatively relaxed. The city is famous for its classical music and dance, with numerous cultural festivals held throughout the year. Marina Beach, one of the longest urban beaches in the world, provides a tranquil escape from the city's hustle and bustle. Chennai's cuisine, particularly its South Indian dishes like dosa and idli, is a culinary delight.

Mumbai (Y), on the other hand, is a city of dreams and opportunities. The city is home to Bollywood, India's thriving film industry, and attracts people from all over the country seeking fame and fortune. Landmarks like the Gateway of India and Marine Drive are iconic symbols of Mumbai's vibrant spirit. The city's street food, including vada pav and pav bhaji, is a must-try for any visitor.

While Chennai offers a glimpse into India's traditional and cultural roots, Mumbai showcases the country's modern and dynamic side. Both cities, though different in essence, highlight the diverse beauty of India. Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: One legendary creature from Indian mythology that has fascinated people for centuries is the Nāga. Nāgas are serpent-like beings, often depicted as half-human and half-cobra, and they hold a significant place in Hindu, Buddhist, and Jain traditions. In Hindu mythology, Nāgas are considered powerful and wise, living in the mystical underground realm of Pātāla. They are guardians of treasures and sacred rivers, and some are even associated with rain and fertility. The most famous Nāga is Shesha, the cosmic serpent who serves as the bed for Lord Vishnu and is said to hold the universe on his many hoods. Nāgas can be both benevolent and vengeful. If respected, they bring prosperity and protection. But if angered—especially by the destruction of their habitats—they can bring misfortune. This dual nature makes them both revered and feared. In many parts of India, especially in the south, people still worship Nagas at serpent shrines, offering milk and flowers to seek blessings or protection. Their presence in folklore, art, and temple architecture continues to inspire awe and curiosity. Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: One legendary creature that captivates imaginations across many cultures is the dragon. Known for its majestic and fearsome presence, dragons are often depicted as large, serpentine creatures with wings, scales, and the ability to breathe fire. In Western folklore, they are typically seen as malevolent beings hoarding treasure, dwelling in caves or atop mountains, and challenging brave knights. The dragon's symbolism in the West often revolves around themes of chaos and destruction, representing a formidable force that heroes must conquer.

Conversely, in Eastern traditions, dragons are revered as benevolent and wise creatures. In Chinese mythology, dragons are associated with water and weather, controlling rainfall and rivers, and are considered symbols of power, strength, and good fortune. They are often depicted with antler-like horns and a long, snake-like body, embodying the harmony of nature. Dragons are celebrated during festivals, such as the Dragon Boat Festival, where they are honored with vibrant rituals and races.

This dichotomy between Eastern and Western depictions of dragons highlights the fascinating diversity in cultural storytelling, where the same creature can embody vastly different traits and morals across regions. Known for its majestic and fearsome presence, dragons are often depicted as large, serpentine creatures with wings, scales, and the ability to breathe fire. In Western folklore, they are typically seen as malevolent beings hoarding treasure, dwelling in caves or atop mountains, and challenging brave knights. The dragon's symbolism in the West often revolves around themes of chaos and destruction, representing a formidable force that heroes must conquer.

Conversely, in Eastern traditions, dragons are revered as benevolent and wise creatures. In Chinese mythology, dragons are associated with water and weather, controlling rainfall and rivers, and are considered symbols of power, strength, and good fortune. They are often depicted with antler-like horns and a long, snake-like body, embodying the harmony of nature. Dragons are celebrated during festivals, such as the Dragon Boat Festival, where they are honored with vibrant rituals and races.

This dichotomy between Eastern and Western depictions of dragons highlights the fascinating diversity in cultural storytelling, where the same creature can embody vastly different traits and morals across regions.</input>

[SEP] Response: Language learning presents a myriad of challenges that students often encounter on their journey to fluency. One of the primary issues is the complexity of grammar rules, which can vary significantly between languages. For instance, students may struggle with verb conjugations, noun genders, or sentence structures that differ from their native language. This complexity can lead to frustration and a lack of confidence in speaking or writing. Another significant challenge is the acquisition of vocabulary. Language learners frequently find it difficult to remember new words and phrases, especially when they are not used in context. This can hinder their ability to engage in conversations or comprehend written texts. Moreover, the fear of making mistakes often prevents students from practicing their speaking skills, which is essential for improvement. Cultural differences also play a crucial role in language learning. Understanding idiomatic expressions, humor, and social norms can be daunting for students, as these elements are deeply rooted in the culture of the language being learned. Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: Language learning is an exciting but challenging process. Students often face difficulties such as pronunciation, vocabulary retention, grammar rules, and conversational fluency. Pronunciation can be tricky, especially when a language has unfamiliar sounds. English learners struggle with "th," while French students find nasal vowels challenging. Without regular practice, mastering these sounds is difficult. Another obstacle is vocabulary retention. Learning new words is easy, but remembering them long-term requires effort. Flashcards, repetition, and using words in daily conversations can help. Grammar rules present another challenge. Many languages have complex structures, irregular verbs, and exceptions. For example, English has unpredictable spelling rules, while German’s gendered nouns can be confusing. Breaking grammar into small sections and practicing daily makes learning manageable. Conversational fluency is often the biggest hurdle. Many students fear making mistakes, which hinders progress. Speaking regularly with native speakers and thinking in the target language builds confidence. Patience and practice are key to overcoming these challenges. With persistence, learners can master a new language and enjoy the process. What has been your biggest challenge in language learning? Pronunciation can be tricky, especially when a language has unfamiliar sounds. English learners struggle with "th," while French students find nasal vowels challenging. Without regular practice, mastering these sounds is difficult. Another obstacle is vocabulary retention. Learning new words is easy, but remembering them long-term requires effort. Flashcards, repetition, and using words in daily conversations can help. Grammar rules present another challenge. Many languages have complex structures, irregular verbs, and exceptions. For example, English has unpredictable spelling rules, while German’s gendered nouns can be confusing. Breaking grammar into small sections and practicing daily makes learning manageable. Conversational fluency is often the biggest hurdle. Many students fear making mistakes, which hinders progress. Speaking regularly with native speakers and thinking in the target language builds confidence. Patience and practice are key to overcoming these challenges. With persistence, learners can master a new language and enjoy the process. What has been your biggest challenge in language learning?
